FuncDef: The statistics enable command enables traffic statistics collection on a Layer 3 sub-interface. The undo statistics enable command disables traffic statistics collection on a Layer 3 sub-interface. By default, traffic statistics collection is disabled on a Layer 3 sub-interface. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: statistics { ipv4 | ipv6 } enable [ inbound | outbound ]
undo statistics { ipv4 | ipv6 } enable [ inbound | outbound ]
ParentView: 100ge sub-interface view,10GE sub-interface view,200GE sub-interface view,25GE sub-interface view,400GE sub-interface view,50GE sub-interface view,Eth-Trunk sub-interface view

ParaDef.Info:
Enables traffic statistics collection of IPv4 packets.
-

Enables traffic statistics collection of IPv6 packets.
-

Enables traffic statistics collection in the inbound direction of an interface.
-

Enables traffic statistics collection in the outbound direction of an interface.
-

ExtraInfo: To check the network status or locate network faults, you can enable traffic statistics collection on Layer 3 sub-interfaces and collect traffic statistics on the Layer 3 sub-interfaces.
